Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Tim is awesome!
Timothy created an environment that encouraged all students to participate. I was most impressed that he answered our questions versus previous TF's who say "I don't know what do you think?

Timothy is very well equipped to teach about the NT. He has an abundance of knowledge that he is able to share effectively and joyfully. I really appreciated how he enabled each member of the class to speak when they felt called to do so. He is very good at leading discussions and facilitating group work during class. He is encouraging, and persistent in helping his students get their learning where they need it to be.

The eval did not have Matthew's name

The ranking below is for him.
Timothy was not my teaching fellow but I'm required to tic the box in order to submit this evaluation.
Tim was a good TF! He helpfully led us through the readings and lectures, providing a good supplement to Professor Dinkler's lectures.
Matthew Seibert
Matthew Siebling
Timothy Gannett.
Timothy Gannett - he was incredible!
Timothy Gannet
Matthew Siebert
Matthew.
Tim
Tim

Strengths - Matthew was consistent with his attendance. However, section was drudgery. His classroom management skills were not adequate to support student discussion. Students argued or sat in silence for long awkward spans of class time. He was often unable to answer legitimate student questions but would say, "what do you guys think?"... Also, he did not review for exams or make time to answer questions about upcoming exams. One paper review session was provided but only used materials already available on the course canvas site.
He is a very young guy with a great domain of the course material, but limited knowledge otherwise. He is sweet, approachable and willing to help and given the circumstances I think he did his best.

Tim was an excellent TF.  He created a warm and inclusive classroom each week.  I grew more confident to raise my hand a make comments over time.  He also brings a unique perspective to the texts, and his passion for his study inspired me as I wrote my papers and studied for my tests.
Timothy was good at encouraging our section to talk and was responsive when I requested feedback on a paper thesis.

I did not feel that Matthew was always entirely ready for section - some of the days appeared to have notably more structure and planning than others. He been more prepared to respond to lulls or confusion in the section discussions.

By far the worst TF I have had at YDS. He was terrible at facilitating discussion, was disrespectful of women, and was an unnecessarily harsh grader. It very often felt as though he did not prepare for section at all. It is such a shame to be forced into his section for such a bread and butter course.

Tim's knowledge of early Christianity and New Testament scholarship is first rate! His sections were engaging and he was accessible for questions outside of class. He would often ask if people wanted to carry on the discussion after the Friday section met.
